sample_text_key: This is a sample text key value
sample_question: How many roads must a man walk down before you can call him a man?
sample_message_with_link: Which search engine do you like best? [Google] or [Bing]?
title_base_css_base_css_fundamental: Fundamental HTML elements styled and enhanced with extensible classes.
text_base_css_typography_headings_descri: All HTML headings, <h1> through <h5> are available.
text_base_css_typography_create_variants: Create variants of the headings using .title and .white classes.
text_base_css_typography_page_title_desc: The Page Title is a <h1> contained within a <div class="title">
text_base_css_typography_white_heading_d: Create a White Heading using the .white class. The .white class can can be used for all headings.
text_base_css_typography_tablet_headings: These are headers for screen size 767px and smaller. All HTML headings, <h1> through <h5>.
Note The below headings for mobile are for display only. You do not need to change anything in your heading tags. The heading will change to the appropriate size automatically.
text_base_css_typography_body_copy_descr: Sherpa's global default font-size is 14px, with a line-height of 20px. This is applied to the <body> and all paragraphs. In addition, <p> (paragraphs) receive a bottom margin of half their line-height (10px by default).
text_base_css_typography_lead_body_copy_: Make a paragraph stand out by adding .lead.
text_base_css_typography_emphasis_descri: Make use of HTML's default emphasis tags with lightweight styles.
text_base_css_typography_small_descripti: For de-emphasizing inline or blocks of text, <small class="sherpa">use the small tag.</small>
text_base_css_typography_bold_descriptio: For emphasizing a snippet of text with a heavier font-weight.
text_base_css_typography_bold_example: The following snippet of text is rendered as bold text.
text_base_css_typography_italics_descrip: For emphasizing a snippet of text with italics.
text_base_css_typography_italics_example: The following snippet of text is rendered as italicized text.
text_base_css_lists_unordered_descriptio: A list of items with no list-style or additional left padding.
text_base_css_lists_ordered_description: A list of items in which the order does explicitly matter.
text_base_css_lists_unstyled_description: A list of items with no list-style or additional left padding.
text_base_css_tables_default_description: For basic styling—light padding and only horizontal dividers—add the base class .table to any <table>.
text_base_css_tables_optional_descriptio: Add any of the following classes to the .table base class.
text_base_css_tables_striped_description: .table-striped adds zebra-striping to any table row within the <tbody> via the :nth-child CSS selector (not available in IE7-8).
text_base_css_tables_bordered_descriptio: .table-bordered adds borders and rounded corners to the table.
text_base_css_tables_hover_description: .table-hover enables a hover state on table rows within a <tbody>.
text_base_css_tables_condensed_descripti: .table-condensed makes tables more compact by cutting cell padding in half.
text_base_css_tables_optional_row_classe: Use contextual classes to color table rows.
text_base_css_tables_supported_markup_de: List of supported table HTML elements and how they should be used.
text_base_css_forms_text_fields_descript: A one-line text field with pre-populated content before the input. Wrap the <span class="add-on"> and input inside <div class="input-prepend">.
text_base_css_forms_radio_buttons_descri: Radio buttons let a user select ONLY ONE of a limited number of choices.
text_base_css_forms_inline_radio_descrip: Add the .inline class to display a series of radios on one line.
text_base_css_forms_inline_checkbox_desc: Add the .inline class to display a series of checkboxes on one line.
text_base_css_forms_checkboxes_descripti: Checkboxes enable the user to make multiple selections.
text_base_css_forms_select_lists_descrip: Select Lists allow the user to select one option from a list of pre-defined options.
text_base_css_forms_search_form_descript: A one-line input field with an appended button. Wrap the input and <button> inside <div class="input-append">.
text_base_css_forms_prepended_input_desc: A one-line text field with pre-populated content before the input. Wrap the <span class="add-on"> and input inside <div class="input-prepend">.
text_base_css_forms_sizing_description: Match your inputs to the grid using the grid classes da-* ta-* ma-*. Or use relative sizing classes like .input-large
text_base_css_forms_help_text_descriptio: Block and Inline support for help and info text that appears within forms.
text_base_css_forms_block_help_descripti: To display Block Help Text add a <span class="help-block"> after input.
text_base_css_forms_inline_help_descript: To display Inline Help Text add a <span class="help-inline"> after input.
text_base_css_forms_inline_help_note: Note Inline Help text must use a relative sized input class.
text_base_css_forms_disabled_description: Add the disabled attribute on an input, radio button or checkbox to prevent user input and trigger a disabled display.
text_base_css_forms_default_layouts_desc: Individual form controls receive styling, but without any required base class on the <form> and <fieldset> layouts will be affected.
The <form> tag is used to create an HTML form for user input. Any form element must be within the <form> tag.
The <fieldset> tag is used to group related elements in a form. Sherpa adds a 10px margin to the bottom of a <fieldset>
text_base_css_forms_shipping_description: The example below showcases the use of the .form-radio and the .form-checkbox classes. These are in place to give the radio and checkbox sections a 20px bottom mragin.
text_base_css_forms_shipping_example_que: Will you be exporting the products you order today outside of the United States of America?
Will you be exporting the products you order today outside of the United States of America?
text_base_css_buttons_default_descriptio: Button styles can be applied to anything with the .btn class applied. However, typically you'll want to apply these to only <a> and <button> elements for the best rendering.
text_base_css_buttons_disabled_descripti: Make buttons look unclickable by fading them back 50%
text_base_css_images_description: Add classes to an img element to easily style images in any project.
text_base_css_containers_description: Add classes to a .div element to easily add rounded corners in any project.
title_base_css_containers_large_rounded_: Container with large rounded border and attached title
title_base_css_containers_example_headli: An example of a really long title
text_base_css_containers_example_lorem: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet Consectetur adipiscing elit Integer molestie lorem at massa Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
text_base_css_icons_ui_description: Use the UI Icons for user interface elements. For crisper UI Icons use the following sizes: 14px, 28px and 42px.
text_base_css_icons_small_description: The Small Icons have less detail and are intended to be used at the default font size of 14px. Please use the Small Icons for task based communications. For crisper Small Icons use the following sizes: 14px, 28px and 42px.
text_base_css_icons_large_description: The Large Icons have more detail then the Small Icons. These should be used to support content only. For crisper Large Icons use the following sizes: 36px, 72px and 108px.
text_base_css_icons_how_to_use_descripti: All icons require an aria-hidden="true" attribute with a unique class. The aria-hidden="true" prevents VoiceOver on OSX. To use, place the following code just about anywhere:
text_base_css_icons_how_to_use_note: Note Since we are treating icons as fonts, we can color and size with ease and without degradation.
text_base_css_modifiers_offsets_descript: Sherpa includes built in margin offset classes that enable you to create additional space between elements.
text_sherpa_footer_description: A responsive prototyping framework for user experience design.<small class="pull-right" itemprop="name">Dell, Inc.</small>
text_get_started_description: Everything you'll need to know to build templates and patterns with ease! Before starting, be sure to have a text editor (we recommend Sublime Text) and some working knowledge of HTML and CSS.
text_grid_description: Sherpa is built on fluid grids, layouts, and components.
text_grid_global_settings_include_instru: Sherpa makes use of certain HTML elements and CSS properties that require the use of the HTML5 doctype. Include it at the beginning of all your projects.
text_configuration_description: Sherpa is highly configurable to fit your specific needs.
text_configuration_localization_descript: The JSON file assets/config/settings_en.json is one of many files that are specific to a locale and contain global configurations for things such as date formats, currency conversion, etc. The file settings_en.json loads by default unless a different locale is specified on the url or core configuration.
text_configuration_localization_example: The contents of this file get placed into the viewModel.config object along with custom configurations:
text_configuration_overrides_description: Each html file can contain override configurations.  This allows you to create different pages that might use different libraries or helper files.
text_configuration_overrides_example: In the head of your HTML document you will notice a script tag. All of the override variables are commented out for your convenience:
text_configuration_overview_description: The Sherpa framework is highly configurable. Configurations are in place to adapt to the diverse needs in User eXperience (UX) prototype modeling. These configurations allow prototypes to run locally or from remote servers. In addition, different javascript libraries can be configured when the prototype page loads. This is done so the framework can be extended to fit your specific needs.
text_configuration_overview_description_: Out of the box, Sherpa is loaded with everything we use to build prototypes ourselves and very seldom you might need to add or remove things. There are several places to configure Sherpa show below.
text_configuration_custom_description: The file assets/js/app.js is where your prototype application is. Here you can add custom configuration variables to the global data view model. These can be used to set up conditionals to display certain components or not.
text_configuration_custom_example: All you have to do is add an element to the addToConfigs object. The sample below would be available in the view model (viewModel.config.sample_custom_config).
text_functions_description: Life in your prototype through dynamic functions.
text_index_the_problem_markdown:
### The Problem

If you are involved in the UX design process you can relate to this story; you've spent months in meetings, countless wireframes, comps, spreadsheets full of requirements, content documents, etcetera.

Now the project is in the hands of developer, armed with the documentation you painstakingly took a lot of time to prepare and throw over the wall. The developer, just into the project, has to distill a diversity of "deliverables" and conclude with the same picture, form and function the UX people had in mind.

Much to your dismay, the developer hardly reads any of the documentation and with an onslaught of meetings, you now have to reinvest in the project time to catch "defects" which ultimately are labeled "enhancements" by dev and out your project goes into production looking very different than what was designed.

Sound familiar?
text_index_the_solution_markdown:
### The Solution

Sherpa is about simplifying the typical plethora of UX deliverables into a homogeneous design ecosystem that provides a singular point of focus for business, design and development to communicate and agree.

Sherpa was built and maintained by UX people collaborating with business people and developers. It is built to fill the needs of the UX, business and development communities equally and usher a process that is focused on velocity, accuracy and reuse.

Sherpa is built using open source technologies such as jQuery, Twitter Boostrap, Knockout.js, underscore.js, gridset and many more. It is highly configurable and open source itself so you can also customize to your needs. Sherpa continues to evolve with one goal in mind, provide the best way to prototype web designs.

Are you ready to get started?
text_index_intro_details: Sherpa is an HTML prototyping framework for rapid creation of responsive, data driven and internationalized prototypes that enables best-in-class user experience design processes.
